1.verse: Origin of the World and Humankind -Creation and the Fall -Chapter 1 -Origin of the Universe. -In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

2.verse: The earth was formless and barren, and darkness covered the abyss while the Spirit of God hovered over the waters.

3.verse: God said, “Let there be light!” And there was light.

4.verse: God saw that the light was good, and he separated the light from the darkness.

5.verse: And he called the light day, and he called the darkness night. This was the evening and the morning of the first day.

6.verse: God said, “Let there be a firmament in the midst of the waters to separate one set of waters from the other.”

7.verse: God separated the firmament from the waters, those waters that are under the firmament from those that are above the firmament. And it was so.

8.verse: God called the firmament the heavens. This was the evening and the morning of the second day.

9.verse: God said, “Let the waters that are under the heavens be gathered into one place and let a dry place appear.” And it was so.

10.verse: God called the dry place the land, and the gathered waters he called the sea. And God saw that it was good.

11.verse: God said, “Let the land bring forth plants, those that produce seeds and fruit trees that have seeds inside of the fruit they bear, each according to its own kind. And it was so.

12.verse: The land brought forth plants, each according to its kind, and trees that have fruit with seeds inside of them, each according to its kind.” God saw that they were good.

13.verse: This was the evening and the morning of the third day.

14.verse: God said, “Let there be lights in the firmament of the heavens to separate the day from the night; let them be markers to separate seasons and days and years,

15.verse: and let them be lights in the firmament of the heavens to give light to the earth.” And it was so.

16.verse: God made the two great lights, the greater light to rule over the day and the lesser light to rule over the night, and he also made the stars.

17.verse: God placed them in the firmament of the heavens to light the earth

18.verse: and to rule over the day and the night and to separate light from darkness. And God saw that it was good.

19.verse: This was the evening and the morning of the fourth day.

20.verse: God said, “Let the waters be filled with living creatures and let birds fly above the earth in the firmament of the heavens.”

21.verse: God created the great sea creatures and all the other creatures that fill the waters, each according to its kind, and all the birds that fly in the sky, each according to its kind.

22.verse: God blessed them saying, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the waters of the sea, and let the birds multiply upon the earth.”

23.verse: And this was the evening and the morning of the fifth day.

24.verse: God said, “Let the earth bring forth living creatures each according to its kind: cattle and reptiles and wild animals, each according to its kind.” And it was so.

25.verse: God made the savage beasts according to their kind and the cattle according to their kind and all of the reptiles according to their kind. And God saw that it was good.

26.verse: And God said, “Let us make human beings in our likeness and image, and let them have dominion over the fish of the sea and over the birds of the sky and over the cattle and over all the wild animals and reptiles that crawl upon the earth.”

27.verse: God created human beings in his image, in the image of God he created them, male and female he created them.

28.verse: God blessed them and told them, “Be fruitful and multiply, and fill the earth; subdue it and have dominion over the fish of the seas and over the birds of the air and over every living creature that moves upon the earth.”

29.verse: And God said, “Behold, I give you every plant that produces seeds upon the earth and every tree that has fruit with its seed inside of it: these shall be your food.

30.verse: And I give all green plants to every wild animal and to all the birds of the air and to all creatures that move upon the surface of the earth and that have the breath of life in them.” And it was so.

31.verse: God saw all that he had made, and behold, it was very good. This was the evening and the morning of the sixth day.

1.verse: Chapter 2 -This is how the heavens and the earth and everything in them were made.

2.verse: God completed his work on the seventh day and on the seventh day he rested from all of his work.

3.verse: God blessed the seventh day and he consecrated it, for on it he rested from all the work he had done when he created all things.

4.verse: This was the origin of the heavens and the earth when they were first created.Origin of Human Beings. - When the Lord God made the earth and the heavens,

5.verse: there were not yet any plants of the field nor had any herbs sprouted in the field, for the Lord God had not yet made it rain upon the earth and there was no one to till the soil.

6.verse: He made a mist rise out of the ground to water the whole surface of the earth.

7.verse: Then the Lord God formed man out of the dust of the earth and he breathed his breath of life into his nostrils and man became a living creature.

8.verse: And the Lord God planted a garden in Eden, in the east, and he put the man he had formed there.

9.verse: The Lord God made all sorts of beautiful and nourishing trees sprout out of the earth, among which was the tree of life in the middle of the garden and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.

10.verse: A river flowed out of Eden to water the garden; then it divided into four tributaries.

11.verse: The first river was called the Pishon. It waters the whole land of Havilah where one can find gold,

12.verse: and the gold of that land is good. One can also find bdellium and onyx in that land.

13.verse: The second river is the Gihon. It flows in the land of Ethiopia.

14.verse: The third river is the Tigris. It flows to the east of the land of Asshur. The fourth river is the Euphrates.

15.verse: The Lord God took the man and placed him in the Garden of Eden so that he might work it and care for it.

16.verse: The Lord God told the man, “You can eat of any of the trees in the garden,

17.verse: but you must never eat from the tree of the knowledge of good and evil. If you were to eat from it, you would surely die.”

18.verse: And the Lord God said, “It is not good for the man to be alone. I wish to make another creature who will be like him.”

19.verse: The Lord God therefore formed every sort of wild animal and all the birds of the air, and he brought them before the man to see what he would name them. Whatever the man called each living creature, that was the name that it would bear.

20.verse: The man gave names to every type of animal, all the birds of the air and all the wild animals, but the man could not find anything that was like him.

21.verse: The Lord God therefore caused the man to fall into a deep sleep. He took one of his ribs and replaced it with flesh.

22.verse: The Lord God then formed a woman out of the rib that he had taken from the man. He brought her before the man.

23.verse: The man said,“This one is bone of my bonesand flesh of my flesh.She shall be called womanbecause she was taken from man.”

24.verse: This is why a man leaves his father and his mother and joins with a wife, and the two become one flesh.

25.verse: Now the man and the woman were naked, but they did not feel any shame.

1.verse: Chapter 3 -Origin of Evil. -The serpent was the most clever of all the wild animals that the Lord God had made. It said to the woman, “Is it true that God told you not to eat of any of the trees in the garden?”

2.verse: The woman answered the serpent, “We may eat of the fruit of the trees in the garden,

3.verse: but as for the fruit of the tree in the midst of the garden, God said that we must not eat it, nor even touch it, lest we die.”

4.verse: But the serpent said to the woman, “Certainly you shall not die!

5.verse: God knows that when you eat from it, your eyes will be opened, and you will become like God, knowing that which is good and that which is evil.”

6.verse: The woman saw that the tree was good for food and pleasing to look at and desirable for imparting wisdom. She took some fruit and ate it. Then she gave some to her husband who was with her, and he also ate it.

7.verse: Their eyes were opened and they realized that they were naked. They took fig leaves and sewed them together, making themselves a covering.

8.verse: They then heard the Lord God walking in the garden toward the evening. The man and his wife hid themselves from the Lord God amongst the trees of the garden.

9.verse: But the Lord God called out to the man and said to him, “Where were you?”

10.verse: He answered, “I heard you walking in the garden and I was afraid because I was naked, so I hid myself.”

11.verse: He said, “Who let you know that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree from which I commanded you not to eat?”

12.verse: The man answered, “The woman whom you put here with me, she gave me some fruit from the tree and I ate it.”

13.verse: The Lord God said to the woman, “What have you done?”The woman answered, “The serpent tricked me and I ate it.”

14.verse: The Lord God said to the serpent,“Because you have done this, you will be the most cursedof all the animalsand of all the wild beasts.On your belly you shall crawland you shall eat dustfor all the days of your life.

15.verse: I will establish hostilitybetween you and the woman,between your line and her line.Her offspring will crush your headand you will bruise his heel.”

16.verse: To the woman he said,“I will multiply your sufferings in childbirth;with pain you shall bear your children.You shall desire your husband,but he shall lord it over you.”

17.verse: To the man he said, “Because you listened to the voice of your wife and you ate from the tree from which I had commanded you not to eat,“Cursed be the soil because of you!With effort you shall obtain foodall the days of your life.

18.verse: Thorns and thistles shall it bring forth for you,and you shall eat of the plants of the field.

19.verse: You shall have to sweatto eat your breaduntil the day when you return to the earth,for from it you were drawn.You are dust,and unto dust you shall return.”

20.verse: The man called his wife Eve, for she was the mother of all those who lived.

21.verse: The Lord God made clothing for the man and woman out of animal skins and he clothed them.

22.verse: The Lord God said, “Behold, man has become like one of us, for he has knowledge of that which is good and that which is evil. Now, we must prevent him from reaching out and taking the fruit of the tree of life lest he eat it and live forever.”

23.verse: The Lord God cast him out of the Garden of Eden; henceforth he was to labor tilling the soil from which he had come.

24.verse: When he expelled him, he placed cherubim to the east of the Garden of Eden with flaming swords to keep watch over the way to the tree of life.

1.verse: The Reign of Sin -Chapter 4 -Hostility toward One’s Neighbor. -Adam was intimate with Eve his wife and she conceived and bore a son named Cain. She said, “I have obtained a son from the Lord.”

2.verse: Next she bore another child named Abel. Abel was a shepherd of flocks and Cain tilled the soil.

3.verse: Some time later Cain offered the fruit of the earth as a sacrifice to the Lord,

4.verse: and Abel offered the firstborn of his flock and their fat offerings. The Lord was pleased with Abel and his offering,

5.verse: but he was not pleased with Cain and his offering. Cain was very angry and his countenance fell.

6.verse: The Lord therefore said to Cain, “Why are you angry and why has your countenance fallen?

7.verse: If you do what is right, will you not be able to hold up your head? But if you do what is wrong, sin is crouching at your door. It seeks to dominate you, but you can overcome it.”

8.verse: Cain said to his brother Abel, “Let us go out into the fields.” While they were walking in the fields, Cain attacked his brother Abel and killed him.

9.verse: Then the Lord asked Cain, “Where is Abel, your brother?” He answered, “I do not know. Am I to be my brother’s keeper?”

10.verse: The Lord told him, “What have you done? Your brother’s blood cries out to me from the soil.

11.verse: Now may you be cursed far from the soil that drank the blood of your brother that you have shed.

12.verse: When you till the soil, it shall not be fruitful for you. You shall be a fugitive and wanderer upon the earth.”

13.verse: Cain told the Lord, “My punishment is too great to bear!

14.verse: Behold, you are banishing me from the soil this day. I will have to hide far from you. I will be a fugitive and wanderer upon the earth, and whoever meets me will be able to kill me.”

15.verse: But the Lord told him, “Not so! Whoever kills Cain will suffer a sevenfold vengeance.” The Lord placed a mark upon Cain, so that no one who might meet him would strike him.

16.verse: Descendants of the Murderer. -Cain left the presence of the Lord and lived in the land of Nod, which lies to the east of Eden.

17.verse: Cain was intimate with his wife, and she conceived and bore Enoch. He became the founder of a city, which he named after his son, Enoch.

18.verse: To Enoch was born Irad. Irad was the father of Mehujael. Mehujael was the father of Methusael. Methusael was the father of Lamech.

19.verse: Lamech had two wives: one named Adah and the other named Zillah.

20.verse: Adah bore Jabal, who was the forefather of those who live in tents and herd cattle.

21.verse: His brother was named Jubal. He was the forefather of those who play the lyre and the flute.

22.verse: Zillah bore Tubalcain, the forger, and forefather of those who forge things made of bronze and iron. The sister of Tubalcain was Naamah.

23.verse: Lamech said to his wives,“Adah and Zillah, listen to my voice;wives of Lamech, lend an ear to what I say.I have killed a man for wounding meand a boy, for bruising me.

24.verse: If Cain received a vengeance of sevenfold,Lamech will receive one of seventy-sevenfold.”

25.verse: First Stages of the History of Salvation. -Adam was once again intimate with his wife, and she bore a son who was named Seth. She said, “God has granted me another child to take the place of Abel whom Cain killed.”

26.verse: Seth also had a son who was named Enosh. It was at this time that people began to call upon the name of the Lord.

1.verse: Chapter 5 -This is the book of genealogy for Adam. When God created man, he made him in the likeness of God;

2.verse: male and female he created them. He blessed them and named them “human.”

3.verse: Adam was one hundred and thirty years old when he had a son in his likeness, who was named Seth.

4.verse: After he had Seth, Adam lived another eight hundred years and had other sons and daughters.

5.verse: Adam lived for nine hundred and thirty years, and then he died.

6.verse: Seth was one hundred and five years old when he had Enosh.

7.verse: After he had Enosh, he lived another eight hundred and seven years and had other sons and daughters.

8.verse: Seth lived for nine hundred and twelve years, and then he died.

9.verse: Enosh was ninety years old when he had Kenan.

10.verse: After he had Kenan, Enosh lived another eight hundred and fifteen years and had other sons and daughters.

11.verse: Enosh lived for nine hundred and five years, and then he died.

12.verse: Kenan was seventy years old when he had Mahalalel.

13.verse: After he had Mahalalel, he lived another eight hundred and forty years and had other sons and daughters.

14.verse: Kenan lived for nine hundred and ten years, and then he died.

15.verse: Mahalalel was sixty-five years old when he had Jared.

16.verse: After he had Jared, he lived another eight hundred and thirty years and had other sons and daughters.

17.verse: Mahalalel lived for eight hundred and ninety-five years, and then he died.

18.verse: Jared was one hundred and sixty-two years old when he had Enoch.

19.verse: After he had Enoch, he lived another eight hundred years and had other sons and daughters.

20.verse: Jared lived for nine hundred and sixty-two years, and then he died.

21.verse: Enoch was sixty-five years old when he had Methuselah.

22.verse: Enoch walked with God. After he had Methuselah, he lived another three hundred years and had other sons and daughters.

23.verse: Enoch lived for three hundred and sixty-five years.

24.verse: Enoch then walked with God and was no more for he was with God.

25.verse: Methuselah was one hundred and eighty-seven years old when he had Lamech.

26.verse: After he had Lamech, he lived another seven hundred and eighty-two years and had other sons and daughters.

27.verse: Methuselah lived for nine hundred and sixty-nine years, and then he died.

28.verse: Lamech was one hundred eighty-two years old when he had a son.

29.verse: He named him Noah, saying, “This one shall be a consolation for the work and labor that we must endure because the Lord has cursed the soil.”

30.verse: After he had Noah, Lamech lived another five hundred ninety-five years and had other sons and daughters.

31.verse: Lamech lived for seven hundred and seventy-seven years, and then he died.

32.verse: Noah was five hundred years old when he had Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

1.verse: Death and Resurrection of God’s Work -Chapter 6 -Widespread Perversion. -When men began to multiply upon the earth, and they began to have daughters,

2.verse: the sons of God saw that the daughters of men were beautiful, and they married as many of them as they wanted.

3.verse: The Lord therefore said, “My spirit will not remain in them forever, for they are flesh and the length of their lives will be one hundred and twenty years.”

4.verse: There were giants upon the earth at this time, as well as afterward. They were the children of the sons of God who married the daughters of men. These were the heroes of times past, men of renown.

5.verse: The Lord saw that the wickedness of men upon the earth was great, and that every plan that their hearts conceived was nothing but evil.

6.verse: The Lord regretted that he had made man upon the earth and his heart was grieved.

7.verse: The Lord said, “I will obliterate man, whom I created, from the earth. Together with man I will eliminate all the cattle and reptiles and the birds of the air, for I regret having made them.”

8.verse: But Noah found favor with the Lord.

9.verse: Salvation through the Righteous. -This is the story of Noah. Noah was a just and blameless man at that time and he walked with God.

10.verse: Noah had three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

11.verse: But the earth was corrupt in God’s sight and filled with violence.

12.verse: God saw that the earth was corrupt, for every person on the earth was perverse in what he did.

13.verse: God therefore said to Noah, “I have decided to end everything, for they have filled the earth with their violence. Behold, I will destroy the entire creation.

14.verse: Build an ark of gopher wood and divide the ark into compartments and caulk it with bitumen inside and out.

15.verse: This is how you shall make it: the ark will be three hundred cubits long, fifty wide, and thirty high.

16.verse: Make a roof on the ark one cubit high. Place a door in the side of the ark. Make it with three decks: lower, middle, and higher.

17.verse: “Behold, I will send a flood. The waters shall cover the earth to destroy the life of everything under the skies that has the breath of life in it. Everything on the earth shall perish.

18.verse: But I will establish a covenant with you.“Go into the ark, you and your sons, your wife, and the wives of your sons.

19.verse: Bring into the ark two of everything that lives, of all flesh. Bring a male and female of each species into the ark to save them.

20.verse: Bring two birds of each species, two animals of each species, and two reptiles of each species with you to save them.

21.verse: As for you, gather every type of food and take it with you. It shall nourish both you and them.”

22.verse: Noah did all of this, exactly as God had commanded him.

1.verse: Chapter 7 -The Lord said to Noah, “Enter into the ark with your entire family, for I have seen that you, of all this generation, are just in my sight.

2.verse: You are to take seven pairs of each type of clean animal with you, male and female. You are to take one pair of each type of unclean animal with you, male and female.

3.verse: You are also to take seven pairs of birds of the air, male and female, with you, so that you may save every species of animal upon the earth.

4.verse: In seven days I will make it begin to rain upon the earth, and it will rain for forty days and forty nights. I will destroy from the face of the earth every living creature I have made.”

5.verse: Noah did all that the Lord had commanded him to do.

6.verse: End of the Sinful World. -Noah was six hundred years old when the flood began and the waters covered the earth.

7.verse: Noah went into the ark with his sons, his wife, and the wives of his sons to escape from the waters of the flood.

8.verse: The clean animals and the unclean animals, the birds, and the creatures that creep on the ground

9.verse: entered the ark two by two, male and female, along with Noah, just as the Lord had commanded.

10.verse: After seven days, the waters of the flood covered the earth;

11.verse: this happened in the six hundredth year of the life of Noah, in the second month, the seventeenth day of the month. On that very day the springs of the great abyss and the floodgates of the heavens opened.

12.verse: The rains fell upon the earth for forty days and forty nights.

13.verse: That day Noah and his sons Shem, Ham, and Japheth entered the ark along with the wife of Noah and the three wives of his sons.

14.verse: They entered along with all living creatures according to their kind, all cattle according to their kind, all creeping creatures according to their kind, and all birds according to their kind.

15.verse: They went into the ark with Noah, two by two, every creature that had breath in it.

16.verse: Those that came, male and female of every type of flesh, entered the ark as God had commanded. The Lord closed the door after them.

17.verse: The flood lasted for forty days. The waters rose and lifted the ark off the earth as they increased.

18.verse: The waters continued to swell and increased greatly on the earth until the ark floated upon the waters.

19.verse: The waters rose more and more on the earth and covered all the highest mountains that are under the heavens.

20.verse: The waters were fifteen cubits over the tops of the mountains that they covered.

21.verse: Every living creature that moves upon the earth, every bird, cattle, wild animal, and creature that crawls upon the earth, and every single person on dry land died.

22.verse: Every creature on dry land that had the breath of life in its nostrils died.

23.verse: This is how every living creature on earth was slain, every human being and every animal, every reptile and every bird of the air. They were blotted out of the earth, and only Noah and those who were with him in the ark survived.

24.verse: The waters covered the earth for one hundred and fifty days.

1.verse: Chapter 8 -The New Creation. -God remembered Noah and all the wild and farm animals that were with him in the ark. God made a wind blow upon the earth, and the waters began to recede.

2.verse: The springs of the abyss and the windows of the heavens were closed, and the rains from the heavens ceased.

3.verse: The waters slowly receded from the earth. At the end of one hundred and fifty days they had greatly diminished.

4.verse: In the seventh month, the seventeenth day of the month, the ark came to rest on Mount Ararat.

5.verse: The waters continued to recede until the tenth month. In the tenth month, the first day of the month, the tops of the mountains came into view.

6.verse: After forty days had gone by, Noah opened the window that he had made in the ark

7.verse: and released a raven to see if the waters had completely dried up. It flew back and forth until the waters upon the earth dried up.

8.verse: Noah then released a dove, to see if the waters had drained from the surface of the earth,

9.verse: but the dove, not finding any place to land, returned to the ark (for the waters still covered the surface of the earth). He reached out and caught the dove and brought it back into the ark.

10.verse: After waiting another seven days, he once again released the dove from the ark.

11.verse: It returned to him toward the evening. In its beak it had a sprig from an olive tree. Noah understood that the waters had receded from the earth.

12.verse: He waited another seven days and then released the dove. It did not return to him.

13.verse: In the six hundred and first year of Noah’s life, in the first month, the first day of the month, the waters dried up upon the earth. Noah removed the covering from the ark and, behold, the surface of the earth was dry.

14.verse: In the second month, the twenty-seventh day of the month, the entire surface of the earth was dry.

15.verse: God commanded Noah,

16.verse: “Leave the ark, you and your wife, your sons and their wives.

17.verse: Take all the animals of every species with you, birds, cattle, all the reptiles that crawl upon the earth, take them all with you. Let them spread out upon the earth. May they be fruitful and multiply upon the earth.”

18.verse: Noah left the ark with his sons, his wife, and his sons’ wives.

19.verse: All the living creatures and all the wild animals, all the birds and all the reptiles that crawl upon the earth, each according to its kind, all left the ark.

20.verse: Noah built an altar to the Lord, took every kind of clean animal and some of every kind of clean bird, and he offered them as burnt offerings upon the altar.

21.verse: The Lord smelled the pleasant odor and said to himself, “I will never again curse the land because of humankind, for the instinct of every human heart is evil from its youth. I will never again destroy every living creature.

22.verse: “As long as the earth endures,seedtime and harvest,cold and heat,summer and winter,day and nightshall not cease.”

1.verse: Chapter 9 -God blessed Noah and his sons and told them, “Be fruitful and multiply and fill the earth.

2.verse: Fear and dread of you will come upon every wild animal and every bird of the air, everything that crawls upon the earth and all the fish of the sea; they will be under your dominion.

3.verse: “Whatever moves and has life will be used for your food. I give you all these things, just as I have already given you every green plant.

4.verse: Only do not eat flesh along with its life, that is, with its blood.

5.verse: For your blood, that is, your life, I will require an accounting. I will require it of every living creature, and I will require it of every human in regard to other humans, each person for his brother.

6.verse: “Whoever spills human blood,that person’s blood will be shed;for in the image of Godhas God made man.

7.verse: And as for you, be fruitful and multiply; become numerous upon the earth and have dominion over it.”

8.verse: Covenant of Mercy. -God said to Noah and his sons,

9.verse: “As for me, I will establish my covenant with you and your descendants after you,

10.verse: with every living creature along with you—the birds, tame and wild animals, and with all the animals which left the ark.

11.verse: I will establish my covenant with you: never again will all living creatures be cut off by the waters of a flood, nor will the earth be laid waste by a flood again.”

12.verse: God said, “This will be a sign of the covenant that I establish between me and you and every living creature for all generations.

13.verse: I will place my rainbow in the clouds and it will be a sign of the covenant between me and the earth.

14.verse: When I gather the clouds over the earth, the rainbow will appear in the clouds.

15.verse: I will remember my covenant between me and you and with every living creature of every kind, that water and flood shall never again destroy all flesh.

16.verse: The rainbow will be in the clouds and I will look upon it and remember the eternal covenant between God and every living creature of every kind that is found upon the earth.”

17.verse: God said to Noah, “This is a sign of the covenant that I am establishing between myself and every creature upon the earth.”

18.verse: A World of Diverse Peoples -The Return of Sin. -The sons of Noah who left the ark were Shem, Ham, and Japheth. Ham was the father of the people of Canaan.

19.verse: These were the three sons of Noah, and from these came all the people on the earth.

20.verse: Now Noah tilled the soil, and he was the first to plant grape vines.

21.verse: He drank some of the wine and he became drunk and lay uncovered inside his tent.

22.verse: Ham, the father of the Canaanites, saw his father lying naked, and he mentioned it to his two brothers who were standing outside.

23.verse: Shem and Japheth took a robe and, holding it in back of them, walked backward toward him and covered their father with it. Having faced backward, they did not see their father naked.

24.verse: When Noah woke up from his drunken slumber, he learned what his youngest son had done to him.

25.verse: Because of this, he said,“Cursed be Canaan!A slave of slavesshall he be to his brothers!”

26.verse: And he continued,“Blessed be the Lord, the God of Shem,and let Canaan be his slave!

27.verse: May God enlarge Japhethso that he dwells in the land of Shem;and let Canaan be his slave!”

28.verse: After the flood, Noah lived for three hundred and fifty years.

29.verse: In all, Noah lived for nine hundred and fifty years, and then he died.

1.verse: Chapter 10 -The Human Family. -These are the descendants of the sons of Noah: Shem, Ham and Japheth, to whom sons were born after the flood.

2.verse: The sons of Japheth were Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meschech, and Tiras.

3.verse: The sons of Gomer were Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

4.verse: The sons of Javan were Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittim, and the Rodanim.

5.verse: From these came the peoples of the islands and their territories, each clan in the nations with their own language.

6.verse: The sons of Ham were Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

7.verse: The sons of Cush were Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca.The sons of Raamah were Sheba and Dedan.

8.verse: Cush gave birth to Nimrod. He was the first of the mighty ones upon the earth.

9.verse: He was a great hunter before the Lord, for it is said, “Just like Nimrod, a great hunter before the Lord.”

10.verse: The beginning of his kingdom was Babel, Erech, and Accad, all of them in the land of Shinar.

11.verse: From that land he went to Asshur where he built Nineveh, Rehoboth-ir, Calah,

12.verse: and Resen between Nineveh and Calah, which is the main city.

13.verse: Mizraim gave birth to the Ludim, Anamim, Lehabim, Naphtuhim,

14.verse: Pathrusim, Casluhim, and Caphtorim (from whom came the Philistines).

15.verse: Canaan gave birth to Sidon, his firstborn, and Heth,

16.verse: and the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,

17.verse: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,

18.verse: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites.Afterward the clans of the Canaanites spread outward.

19.verse: The boundaries of the Canaanites stretch from Sidon in the area of Gerar up to Gaza, and then go toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, up to Lasha.

20.verse: These were the sons of Ham according to their clans and their languages, in their various territories and according to their peoples.

21.verse: Shem, the ancestor of all of the sons of Eber and the older brother of Japheth, also had children.

22.verse: The sons of Shem were Elam, Asshur, Arpachshad, Lud, and Aram.

23.verse: The sons of Aram were Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

24.verse: Arpachshad gave birth to Shelah, and Shelah gave birth to Eber.

25.verse: Eber had two sons: one named Peleg (for in his days the earth was divided) and the other named Joktan.

26.verse: Joktan gave birth to Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

27.verse: Hadoram, Uzal, Diklah,

28.verse: Obal, Abimael, Sheba,

29.verse: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were the sons of Joktan.

30.verse: They lived in the mountain region in the east, from Mesha on toward Sephar.

31.verse: These were the sons of Shem according to their clans and their languages, in their various territories and according to their languages.

32.verse: These were the families of the sons of Noah in their various generations and clans. These divided up to become all the nations on the earth after the flood.

1.verse: Chapter 11 -An Attempt at Unity. -The whole world had only one language, everyone using the same words.

2.verse: Migrating from the east, men came upon a plain in the land of Shinar where they settled.

3.verse: They said to each other, “Come, let us make bricks and bake them in a fire.” These bricks were what they used instead of stone, and bitumen in place of cement.

4.verse: Then they said, “Come, let us build a city and a tower so high that it touches the heavens. We shall make a name for ourselves and not be scattered all throughout the earth.”

5.verse: But the Lord came down and saw the city and the tower that these men were building.

6.verse: The Lord said, “Behold, they are a single people and they have only one language. This is only the beginning of what they will do. Now nothing that they think up will be impossible for them.

7.verse: Let us go down and confuse their language so that they will not understand each other when they speak.”

8.verse: The Lord scattered them over the whole earth and they ceased building their city.

9.verse: This is why it is called Babel, for there the Lord confused everyone’s language. It was also from there that the Lord scattered people over the whole earth.

10.verse: Genealogy of Abraham. -The descendants of Shem are as follow:Shem was one hundred years old when he had Arpachshad two years after the flood.

11.verse: Shem, after he had Arpachshad, lived another five hundred years and had other sons and daughters.

12.verse: Arpachshad was thirty-five years old when he had Shelah.

13.verse: Arpachshad, after he had Shelah, lived another four hundred and three years and had other sons and daughters.

14.verse: Shelah was thirty years old when he had Eber.

15.verse: Shelah, after he had Eber, lived another four hundred and three years and had other sons and daughters.

16.verse: Eber was thirty-four years old when he had Peleg.

17.verse: Eber, after he had Peleg, lived another four hundred and thirty years and had other sons and daughters.

18.verse: Peleg was thirty years old when he had Reu.

19.verse: Peleg, after he had Reu, lived another two hundred and nine years and had other sons and daughters.

20.verse: Reu was thirty-two years old when he had Serug.

21.verse: Reu, after he had Serug, lived another two hundred and seven years and had other sons and daughters.

22.verse: Serug was thirty years old when he had Nahor.

23.verse: Serug, after he had Nahor, lived another two hundred years and had other sons and daughters.

24.verse: Nahor was twenty-nine years old when he had Terah.

25.verse: Nahor, after he had Terah, lived one hundred and nineteen years and had other sons and daughters.

26.verse: Terah was seventy years old when he had Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

27.verse: These are the descendants of Terah.Terah had Abram, Nahor, and Haran. Haran had Lot.

28.verse: Haran then died in the presence of his father Terah in the land of his birth, in Ur of the Chaldeans.

29.verse: Abram and Nahor both married. The wife of Abram was Sarai, and the wife of Nahor was Milcah who was a daughter of Haran (the father of Milcah and Iscah).

30.verse: Sarai was barren and did not have any children.

31.verse: Then Terah took Abram, his son, and Lot, the son of Haran, and Sarai, his daughter-in-law and the wife of Abram his son, and he left Ur of the Chaldeans to go to the land of Canaan. They went as far as Haran where they settled.

32.verse: Terah lived to be two hundred and five years old. Terah died in Haran.

1.verse: Origin of the People of God -Abraham, Man of Faith -Chapter 12 -“Leave Your Country [and] Your People.” -The Lord said to Abram, “Leave your country, your people, and the house of your father, and go to the land to which I will lead you.

2.verse: “I will make of you a greatpeople and I will bless you.I will make your name greatand it will become a blessing.

3.verse: I will bless those who blessyou and curse those who curse you.And through youall the nations on the earth shall be blessed.”

4.verse: Abram therefore departed, just as the Lord had ordered him. Lot went along with him. Abram was seventy-five years old when he left Haran.

5.verse: Abram took his wife Sarai, Lot, the son of his brother, and all the possessions that they had accumulated in Haran, and all the people whom they had acquired in Haran, and left for the land of Canaan. Thus, they arrived in the land of Canaan.

6.verse: Abram traveled through the land until he arrived at Shechem near the oak of Moreh. In those days the Canaanites lived in that land.

7.verse: The Lord appeared to Abram and said to him, “I will give this land to your descendants.” Abram therefore built an altar there to the Lord who had appeared to him.

8.verse: From there he traveled into the mountain region to the east of Bethel and he pitched his tent so that Bethel was to the west and Ai was to his east. There he built an altar to the Lord and called upon the name of the Lord.

9.verse: Then Abram set out again, gradually traveling toward the Negeb.

10.verse: Abram a Refugee in Egypt. -There was a famine in the land and Abram went down to Egypt to stay there for a time, for the famine was very serious in the land.

11.verse: But, when he was about to enter Egypt, he said to Sarai, his wife, “Look, I realize that you are a very beautiful woman.

12.verse: When the Egyptians see you, they will think, ‘She is his wife,’ and they will kill me, leaving you alive.

13.verse: Therefore, say that you are my sister, so that they will treat me well and let me live because of you.”

14.verse: When Abram arrived in Egypt, the Egyptians saw that his wife was very beautiful.

15.verse: The stewards of Pharaoh saw her and told Pharaoh how beautiful she was. They took the woman and brought her to the house of Pharaoh.

16.verse: Because of her they treated Abram well. He received flocks and herds, male and female slaves, female donkeys, and camels.

17.verse: But the Lord struck Pharaoh and his household with terrible plagues because of Sarai, the wife of Abram.

18.verse: Therefore, Pharaoh summoned Abram and said to him, “What have you done to me? Why did you not tell me that she was your wife?

19.verse: Why did you say, ‘She is my sister,’ so that I ended up taking her as my wife? Here is your wife; take her and leave!”

20.verse: Then Pharaoh entrusted him to some men who accompanied him to the borders along with his wife and all his belongings.

1.verse: Chapter 13 -Growth in Faith. -From Egypt Abram traveled to the Negeb along with his wife and all his belongings. Lot was with him.

2.verse: Abram was very rich, having many animals, silver, and gold.

3.verse: He then gradually made his way from the Negeb to Bethel, up to the place where he had previously encamped between Bethel and Ai.

4.verse: This was the place where he had built an altar and called upon the name of the Lord.

5.verse: Lot, who traveled with Abram, also had many flocks and herds and tents.

6.verse: The area where they were was not rich enough for them to dwell together, for they had too many possessions for them to live in the same camp.

7.verse: Because of this a quarrel arose between the herdsmen of Abram and those of Lot. (At that time the Canaanites and the Perizzites lived in that land.)

8.verse: Abram said to Lot, “Let us not have strife between you and me, between my herdsmen and yours, for we are relatives.

9.verse: Does not the entire land lie before you? You should separate from me. If you wish to go to the left, I will go to the right; if you wish to go to the right, I will go to the left.”

10.verse: Lot looked around and saw that the Jordan Valley was fertile and there was water everywhere. (This was before the Lord destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah.) It was as beautiful as the garden of the Lord, like the land of Egypt, all the way down to Zoar.

11.verse: So Lot chose the Jordan Valley for himself, and he moved his tents to the east. Thus, they separated from each other.

12.verse: Abram dwelt in the land of Canaan and Lot dwelt in the cities of the valley and pitched his tents near Sodom.

13.verse: The inhabitants of Sodom were perverse and committed many sins against the Lord.

14.verse: The Lord spoke to Abram after Lot had separated from him saying, “Lift up your eyes from where you are and look around to the north and south, to the east and the west.

15.verse: Everything that you see I will give to you and your descendants forever.

16.verse: I will make your descendants like the dust of the earth. If one could count all of the dust of the earth, then that person would be able to count all your descendants.

17.verse: Rise and travel throughout the land, for I will give it to you.”

18.verse: Abram moved his camp and dwelt near the Oak of Mamre at Hebron. He built an altar to the Lord there.

1.verse: Chapter 14 -Lot’s Captivity and Rescue. -When Amraphel was king of Shinar, Arioch king of Ellasar, Chedorlaomer king of Elam, and Tidal king of Goiim,

2.verse: there was a war between them and Bera, king of Sodom, Birsha, king of Gomorrah, Shinab, king of Admah, Shemeber, king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela (that is, Zoar).

3.verse: All the latter kings gathered in the Valley of Siddim, that is, the Dead Sea.

4.verse: For twelve years they were vassals of Chedorlaomer, but in the thirteenth year they rebelled against him.

5.verse: In the fourteenth year Chedorlaomer and the kings allied with him arrived and defeated the Rephaim in Ashteroth-karnaim, the Zuzim in Ham, the Emim in Shaveh-kiriathaim

6.verse: and the Horites on Mount Seir as far as El-paran, which borders the desert.

7.verse: They then changed direction and came to En-mishpat (that is, Kedesh), and they plundered the land of the Amalekites as well the Amorites who lived in Hazazon-tamar.

8.verse: The king of Sodom, the king of Gomorrah, the king of Admah, the king of Zeboiim, and the king of Bela, that is, Zoar, went out to the Valley of Siddim and did battle with them,

9.verse: with Chedorlaomer, king of Elam, Tidal, king of Goiim, Amraphel, king of Shinar, and Arioch, king of Ellasar. There were four kings against five.

10.verse: Now the Valley of Siddim was full of bitumen pools. When the kings of Sodom and Gomorrah fled, they fell into these pools. The others fled into the mountains.

11.verse: The four kings took all the possessions and provisions of Sodom and Gomorrah and left.

12.verse: They also captured Lot, the son of the brother of Abram, and all his possessions (for he lived in Sodom).

13.verse: One of those who escaped captivity came and reported this to Abram the Hebrew who was camped at the Oak of Mamre the Amorite, the brother of Eshcol and Aner, who were Abram’s allies.

14.verse: When Abram heard that his relative had been taken prisoner, he organized the armed men who had been born to his household. There were three hundred and eighteen of them. They gave chase as far as Dan.

15.verse: He divided his forces and his servants, and defeated them during the night, following them all the way to Hobah, to the north of Damascus.

16.verse: He recovered the booty and also Lot, his relative, and his possessions, as well as the women and the other people.

17.verse: Meeting with Melchizedek near Jerusalem. -When Abram returned after defeating Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, the king of Sodom met him in the Valley of Shaveh, that is, the Valley of the King.

18.verse: Melchizedek, the king of Salem, offered bread and wine. As a priest of God Most High,

19.verse: he blessed Abram with these words,“Blessed be Abram by God Most High,Creator of the heavens and the earth.

20.verse: And blessed be God Most Highwho has delivered your enemy into your hands.”Then Abram gave him a tithe of all he had taken.

21.verse: The king of Sodom said to Abram, “Give me the people; you take the booty.”

22.verse: But Abram said to the king of Sodom, “I have sworn to the Lord, God Most High, Creator of the heavens and the earth,

23.verse: that I would not take anything for myself, not even a thread or a sandal strap, lest you be able to say, ‘I have enriched Abram.’

24.verse: I want nothing for myself other than what my servants have already eaten. As for the men who have accompanied me, Eshcol, Aner, and Mamre, they can take their own shares.”

1.verse: Chapter 15 -The Covenant Guarantee of the Promise. -Some time later the Lord communicated these words to Abram in a vision,“Do not fear, Abram.I am your shield;your reward shall be very great.”

2.verse: Abram answered, “My Lord God, what will you give me? I will pass away without children and my heir will be Eliezer of Damascus.”

3.verse: Abram continued, “Behold, you have not given me descendants, and my servant will be my heir.”

4.verse: Then the word of the Lord came unto him, “He will not be your heir; your own child will be your heir.”

5.verse: Then he led him outside and told him, “Look into the heavens and count the stars, if you can count them. Such,” he continued, “will your descendants be.”

6.verse: Abraham believed the Lord, who credited it to him as righteousness.

7.verse: And he said, “I am the Lord who brought you out of Ur of the Chaldeans to take possession of this land.”

8.verse: He answered, “O Lord God, how will I know that I am to possess it?”

9.verse: He said, “Take a three-year-old heifer, a three-year-old she-goat, a three-year-old ram, a turtledove, and a young pigeon.”

10.verse: He took all these animals and split them in two and placed each half opposite the other (except for the birds).

11.verse: Birds of prey landed upon the carcasses, but Abram chased them away.

12.verse: As the sun was setting, a trance fell upon Abram, and a fearful darkness descended upon him.

13.verse: The Lord said to Abram, “Know that your descendants shall be foreigners in a land that is not their own. They shall be made slaves and oppressed for four hundred years.

14.verse: But I will execute my judgment upon the nation that they will have served. They will leave it with great riches.

15.verse: As for you, you will go in peace to your fathers, and you will be buried at a happy old age.

16.verse: In the fourth generation they will return here, for the iniquity of the Amorites has not yet come to full measure.”

17.verse: When the sun set, it was dark, and a smoking brazier and a flaming torch passed between the carcasses of the animals that had been split in two.

18.verse: On that day the Lord made a covenant with Abram, “To your descendants I will give this land, from the river of Egypt to the great river, the Euphrates,

19.verse: the dwelling place of the Kenites, the Kenizzites, the Kadmonites,

20.verse: the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Rephaim,

21.verse: the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.”

1.verse: Chapter 16 -Abram’s Son Ishmael. -Now Sarai, the wife of Abram, did not have any children. She had an Egyptian slave named Hagar.

2.verse: Sarai said to Abram, “Behold, the Lord has kept me from having children; sleep with my slave. Maybe I can have children through her.”Abram did what Sarai had told him to do.

3.verse: Thus, ten years after Abram had begun to live in the land of Canaan, Sarai, the wife of Abram, took Hagar the Egyptian, her slave, and gave her to Abram her husband as a wife.

4.verse: He slept with Hagar, and she became pregnant.But once she realized that she was pregnant, she no longer treated her mistress with respect.

5.verse: Therefore, Sarai said to Abram, “May this affront fall upon you! I gave you my maid to embrace, but when she realized that she was pregnant, she stopped treating me with respect. Let the Lord judge between you and me.”

6.verse: Abram said to Sarai, “Behold, your slave is in your hands. Do with her as you see fit.” Sarai then maltreated her so much that Hagar ran away.

7.verse: The angel of the Lord found her near a spring in the desert. The spring was on the road to Shur.

8.verse: The angel said to her, “Hagar, slave of Sarai, where have you come from and where are you going?” She answered, “I am running away from my mistress Sarai.”

9.verse: The angel of the Lord said to her, “Return to your mistress and be obedient to her.”

10.verse: The angel of the Lord continued, “I will multiply the number of your descendants so much that you will not be able to count them.”

11.verse: The angel of the Lord added,“Behold, you are pregnant:you will bear a sonand call him Ishmael,for the Lord has listened to you in your distress.

12.verse: He will be a wild donkey of a man;his hand will be against alland the hands of all will be against him.He will be opposed to all of his brothers.”

13.verse: Hagar gave a name to the Lord who had spoken to her, “You are the God of the Vision.” Therefore, she said, “Here I remained alive after having received this vision.”

14.verse: Because of this, the well is called Beer-lahai-roi. It is between Kedesh and Bered.

15.verse: Hagar gave birth to Abram’s son. Abram named the son whom Hagar had borne Ishmael.

16.verse: Abram was eighty-six years old when Hagar gave birth to Ishmael.

1.verse: Chapter 17 -The Covenant and Its Sign. -When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the Lord appeared to him and said, “I am God Almighty. Walk before me and be blameless.

2.verse: I will establish my covenant between me and you and I will multiply you greatly.”

3.verse: Abram immediately fell down upon his face. God said to him,

4.verse: “On my part, behold, my covenant with you: you will be the father of many nations.

5.verse: You will no longer be called Abram, but Abraham, for I will make you the father of many nations.

6.verse: I will make you very, very fruitful. I will make nations come from you, and you shall give birth to kings.

7.verse: I will establish my covenant with you for all generations. It will be an eternal covenant. I will be your God and the God of your descendants after you.

8.verse: I will give you and your descendants after you this land where you are now an alien. All of the land of Canaan shall be your eternal possession. I will be your God.”

9.verse: God said to Abraham, “On your part, you must observe my covenant, you and your descendants after you, for all time.

10.verse: This is my covenant that you must observe, a covenant between me and your descendants after you: every male among you must be circumcised.

11.verse: You shall circumcise the flesh of the male member. This shall be the sign of the covenant between me and you.

12.verse: Whenever baby boys are eight days old, they will be circumcised, whether they are your own children or the children of those whom you bought and who are foreigners and not of your bloodline.

13.verse: You must circumcise those who are born in your house and those who are bought by you. Thus, my covenant will be marked in your flesh as an eternal covenant.

14.verse: The male who is not circumcised, the one whose flesh of his member is not circumcised, is to be cut off from his people. He will have violated my covenant.”

15.verse: God also said to Abraham, “As for Sarai, your wife, she will no longer be called Sarai, but rather Sarah.

16.verse: I will bless her and I will give you and her a son. I will bless her so that she shall become the mother of nations; kings of peoples shall descend from her.”

17.verse: Abraham bowed down to the earth and laughed when he thought, “Shall a man who is one hundred years old have a son? And Sarah, who is ninety years old, can she give birth?”

18.verse: Abraham said to God, “If only Ishmael might live in your presence!”

19.verse: But God said, “No, but Sarah, your wife, shall bear you a son, and you shall name him Isaac. I will establish my covenant with him as an eternal covenant, that I will be his God and the God of his descendants after him.

20.verse: As for Ishmael, I have heard you. Behold, I will bless him and make him fruitful and very, very numerous. Twelve princes shall come from him and I will make him a great nation.

21.verse: But I will establish my covenant with Isaac. Sarah shall give birth to him by this time next year.”

22.verse: God thus finished speaking to Abraham, and rising into the heavens, he left him.

23.verse: Abraham therefore took Ishmael his son and all those born into his house and all those whom he had bought—all the males belonging to the household of Abraham—and he circumcised the flesh of their foreskins that same day, as the Lord had commanded him.

24.verse: Abraham was ninety-nine years old when he had the flesh of his foreskin circumcised.

25.verse: Ishmael, his son, was thirteen years old when the flesh of his foreskin was circumcised.

26.verse: Abraham and his son Ishmael were circumcised that same day.

27.verse: And all the men of his household, those born in his house and those foreigners bought with money, were circumcised with him.

1.verse: Chapter 18 -God Becomes a Guest. -The Lord appeared to Abraham at the Oak of Mamre while he was sitting at the entrance to his tent during the hottest part of the day.

2.verse: He looked up and saw three men standing nearby. As soon as he saw them, he ran to meet them from the entrance of his tent and bowed down to the ground,

3.verse: saying, “My lord, if I have found favor with you, please do not pass on without stopping to visit your servant.

4.verse: Let some water be brought so that you may wash your feet. Make yourselves comfortable under this tree.

5.verse: Let me go and prepare a bit of food that you may refresh yourselves. Afterward, you can go on your way. It is for this that you have come to visit your servant.”They answered, “Do as you have said.”

6.verse: So Abraham hurried into the tent and said to Sarah, “Quick, take three seahs of fine flour, knead it, and make it into rolls.”

7.verse: He ran to the herd, took a choice calf, and gave it to his servant, who quickly prepared it.

8.verse: He then took curds and milk, as well as the veal that had been prepared, and he placed them before his guests. And he stood by them under the tree while they ate.

9.verse: They then said, “Where is Sarah, your wife?” He answered, “She is in the tent.”

10.verse: The Lord said, “I will return this way a year from now, and by that time Sarah, your wife, will have a son.” Sarah was listening at the entrance to the tent, just behind him.

11.verse: Abraham and Sarah were old, advanced in years. Sarah no longer had her monthly periods.

12.verse: Sarah therefore laughed to herself and said, “After I am withered and my husband is old, will I now have this pleasure?”

13.verse: But the Lord said to Abraham, “Why is Sarah laughing and saying, ‘Can I really give birth now that I am so old?’

14.verse: Is anything impossible to the Lord? I will return to you at the appointed time, one year from now, and Sarah will have a son.”

15.verse: Sarah denied laughing, saying, “I did not laugh,” because she was afraid. But he said, “Yes, you did laugh.”

16.verse: The “Friend” of God. -The men rose up and went along to look down upon Sodom from on high while Abraham accompanied them to show them the way.

17.verse: The Lord said, “Should I keep hidden from Abraham what I am about to do,

18.verse: for Abraham shall become a great and powerful nation and all of the nations of the earth shall be blessed through him?

19.verse: I chose him so that he would instruct his sons and his family after him to observe the ways of the Lord and to act with justice and righteousness so that the Lord might fulfill what he has promised to Abraham.”

20.verse: Therefore, the Lord said, “The cry against Sodom and Gomorrah is too great and their sin is very grave.

21.verse: I am going to descend to see if they have really done all the evil that has cried out to me. I want to know this!”

22.verse: While the two men departed and journeyed toward Sodom, Abraham remained standing before the Lord.

23.verse: Abraham approached him and said to him, “Is it true that you will destroy the just along with the wicked?

24.verse: What if there are fifty righteous people in the city? Will you really destroy it? Will you not spare it for the sake of the fifty righteous people that you found there?

25.verse: Far be it from you to make the righteous die along with the wicked, so that the righteous would have the same fate as the wicked. Far be it from you! Is it possible that the judge of the whole earth does not practice justice?”

26.verse: The Lord answered, “If I find fifty righteous people living in the city of Sodom, for their sake I will spare the city.”

27.verse: Abraham spoke again, “Look how I dare to speak with my Lord, I who am dust and ashes.

28.verse: What if there are five fewer than fifty righteous people, will you destroy the entire city because of those five?”He answered, “I will not destroy it if I find forty-five there.”

29.verse: Abraham spoke again and said, “What if you find forty there?” He answered, “I will not do it, for the sake of those forty.”

30.verse: And again he said, “Let my Lord not grow impatient with me if I continue to speak; what if thirty are found there?” He answered, “I will not do it if I find thirty there.”

31.verse: Once again he said, “Look how I dare to talk to my Lord! What if you find twenty there?” He said, “I will not destroy it, for the sake of those twenty.”

32.verse: Yet again he said, “My Lord, do not grow impatient if I speak still another time; what if ten are found there?” He answered, “I will not destroy it, for the sake of the ten.”

33.verse: When the Lord had finished speaking with Abraham, he went on his way, and Abraham returned to his tent.

1.verse: Chapter 19 -Revelation of God the Judge. -The two angels arrived in Sodom toward the evening. Lot was seated at the gate to Sodom. As soon as he saw them, Lot got up and went over to them and bowed down to the ground.

2.verse: He said, “My lords, come to the house of your servant. Pass the night, wash your feet, and then, in the morning, you can go on your way.”They answered, “No, we will spend the night in the town square.”

3.verse: But he insisted so much that they went with him to his house. He prepared a banquet for them, making unleavened bread, and they ate their meal.

4.verse: But before they went to bed, the men of the city, the inhabitants of Sodom, gathered around the house, the young and the old, all of them without exception.

5.verse: They called out to Lot and said, “Where are those men who are staying with you tonight? Make them come out to us so that we can know them!”

6.verse: Lot went out to them at the door and, after closing the door behind himself,

7.verse: said, “No, my brothers, do not do this evil thing!

8.verse: Listen, I have two daughters who have not yet known a man; let me bring them outside and you can do whatever you want with them. Just do not do anything to these men, for they have entered under the shelter of my roof.”

9.verse: But they answered, “Move out of the way. This one has come into our midst as a foreigner and he would dare to judge us! Now we are going to treat you even worse than them.” And they so violently pushed against Lot that they almost broke open the door.

10.verse: But the men inside reached out and pulled Lot inside the house, closing the door.

11.verse: They struck all of those who were standing outside the door with blindness so that none of them could find the door.

12.verse: The men then said to Lot, “Who else do you have here? Your sons-in-law, your sons, and your daughters, and anyone that you have in the city, bring them out of this place

13.verse: for we are ready to destroy this place. The complaint raised against them before the Lord is great, and the Lord has sent us to destroy it.”

14.verse: Lot left to speak to his sons-in-law, the men who were to marry his daughters, and he said, “Get up, let us go from this place, for the Lord is about to destroy the city.” But his sons-in-law thought he was joking.

15.verse: As dawn was breaking, the angels urged Lot on, saying, “Get up, take your wife and the two daughters who are here and leave before you are caught up in the punishment of this city.”

16.verse: Lot hesitated, but the men took him by the hand, along with his wife and his two daughters. They showed him the mercy of the Lord by bringing him out and leading him out of the city.

17.verse: After they had led him out, one of them said, “Flee for your life. Do not look back and do not stop while you are still in the valley. Flee to the mountains lest you be swept away.”

18.verse: But Lot replied, “No, my lord!

19.verse: Look, your servant has found favor in your sight, and now you have shown even greater mercy to me by saving my life. Yet, I will not be able to flee to the mountains to keep the disaster from overtaking me. I will die.

20.verse: Look at this city ahead. It is close enough for me to reach, and it is so small! Let me flee there. It is such a small place. That way my life will be saved.”

21.verse: He answered, “Behold, I will grant you even this, that I will not destroy the city of which you have spoken.

22.verse: Hurry, flee there because I cannot do anything until you have arrived.” For this reason the city is called Zoar.

23.verse: The sun was rising when Lot arrived in Zoar.

24.verse: The Lord then rained sulfur and fire from the heavens upon Sodom and Gomorrah.

25.verse: He destroyed these cities and the entire valley and all the inhabitants of the cities and even the plants in the soil.

26.verse: But the wife of Lot looked back, and she became a pillar of salt.

27.verse: Abraham went out early in the morning to the place where he had been with the Lord.

28.verse: He looked down from the height on Sodom and Gomorrah and the entire extension of the valley, and he saw smoke rising out of the earth, like the smoke coming out of a furnace.

29.verse: Thus God, who destroyed the cities of the valley, remembered Abraham and had Lot flee from the disaster, while he destroyed the cities in which Lot had been living.

30.verse: Degeneration of Lot’s Children. -Lot then left Zoar and went to live in the mountains together with his two daughters, for they were afraid to stay in Zoar. He lived in a cave with his two daughters.

31.verse: The older one said to the younger one, “Our father is getting old and there is no one in this territory to marry us as happens all over the earth.

32.verse: Come, we will give wine to our father and then lie with him; thus we will provide descendants for our father.”

33.verse: That night they gave wine to their father, and the older sister laid with her father. He did not realize what was happening, not even when she lay down or when she got out of bed.

34.verse: The next day the older sister said to the younger, “Behold, yesterday I slept with my father. Let us make him drink wine tonight as well and you can sleep with him. Thus, we will provide descendants for our father.”

35.verse: That night as well they made their father drink wine, and the younger sister slept with him. He did not realize what had happened, not even when she lay down or when she got out of bed.

36.verse: Thus, the two daughters of Lot conceived children for their father.

37.verse: The older sister gave birth to a son whom she called Moab, “from my father.” He is the forefather of the present-day Moabites.

38.verse: The younger sister also gave birth to a son, and she called him Ben Ammi, “son of my people.” He is the forefather of the present-day Ammonites.

1.verse: Chapter 20 -God Corrects His Faithful Ones. -Abraham broke camp and traveled into the Negeb, settling between Kedesh and Shur. He was dwelling in Gerar.

2.verse: Abraham had said that Sarah, his wife, was his sister. Therefore, Abimelech, king of Gerar, sent to take Sarah for himself.

3.verse: But God visited Abimelech during the night in a dream and said to him, “Behold, you are about to die because the woman you have taken belongs to her husband.”

4.verse: Abimelech, who had not yet approached her, said, “My Lord, would you destroy an innocent nation?

5.verse: Did he not tell me, ‘She is my sister’? And did she not also say, ‘He is my brother’? I did this with a pure conscience and in all innocence.”

6.verse: God answered him in the dream, “I know that you acted with a good conscience when you did this. I prevented you from sinning against me. That is why I kept you from touching her.

7.verse: Now give the woman back to this man. He is a prophet. He will intercede for you, and you will live. But if you do not restore her, know that you and everyone with you will die.”

8.verse: Abimelech got up early in the morning and summoned all his servants to whom he recounted all these things. The men were terrified.

9.verse: Then Abimelech summoned Abraham and told him, “What have you done to us? What did I do to you that you have subjected me and my kingdom to such a great sin? You have done things to me that you really should not have done.”

10.verse: Then Abimelech asked Abraham, “What were you afraid of that you acted this way?”

11.verse: Abraham answered, “I said to myself, ‘Certainly there will be no fear of God in this place, and they will kill me because of my wife.’

12.verse: Besides, she is really my sister, the daughter of my father, but not the daughter of my mother; and she became my wife.

13.verse: When God made me wander from my father’s homeland, I said to her, ‘Please do me this favor. Wherever we go, say that I am your brother.’ ”

14.verse: Abimelech took flocks and herds, male and female slaves, and he gave them to Abraham, and he also gave back his wife Sarah.

15.verse: Furthermore, Abimelech said, “Look around at my land; go and live wherever you please!”

16.verse: To Sarah he said, “Behold, I have given two thousand shekels of silver to your brother. May that repay you for what has happened to you. Thus, your honor will be totally preserved.”

17.verse: Abraham prayed to God and God healed Abimelech, his wife, and his maidservants so that they could once more have children.

18.verse: For the Lord had rendered all the women in the household of Abimelech sterile because of Sarah, the wife of Abraham.

1.verse: Chapter 21 -The Promised Son. -The Lord visited Sarah, as he had said he would. The Lord fulfilled what he had promised to Sarah.

2.verse: Sarah conceived and bore a son to Abraham in his old age at the very time that the Lord had established.

3.verse: Abraham named the son whom Sarah bore Isaac.

4.verse: Abraham circumcised his son Isaac when he was eight days old, as God had commanded him to do.

5.verse: Abraham was one hundred years old when his son Isaac was born.

6.verse: Sarah said, “God has given me a reason to laugh out loud. All will smile because of me.”

7.verse: She then said, “Who would have ever said to Abraham, ‘Sarah will nurse sons’? Yet I have borne him a son in his old age.”

8.verse: Ishmael Is Sent Away. -Isaac grew and was weaned. On the day that he was weaned, Abraham threw a great banquet.

9.verse: But Sarah saw the son of Hagar the Egyptian, the one whom she had borne to Abraham, playing with her son Isaac.

10.verse: She said to Abraham, “Send this slave and her son away, for the son of this slave must not be an heir together with my son Isaac.”

11.verse: This greatly distressed Abraham for he was concerned for his son.

12.verse: But God said to Abraham, “Do not let this matter with your son and the slave woman distress you. Listen to what Sarah tells you. Listen to her voice, for it is through Isaac that descendants will bear your name.

13.verse: But I will also make the son of the slave woman become a great nation, for he is your son.”

14.verse: Abraham arose early in the morning and gave Hagar bread and a skin of water, placing them on her back. He entrusted the child to her and sent her away. They left and wandered in the desert of Beer-sheba.

15.verse: When they used up all the water in the skin, she placed the child under a bush

16.verse: and went and sat down opposite him, about the distance of a bowshot. She said, “I do not want to see the child die.” She sat opposite him and began to sob.

17.verse: But God heard the voice of the child, and the angel of God called upon Hagar from the heavens and said, “What is the matter, Hagar? Do not fear because God has heard the voice of the child from where he lies.

18.verse: Get up, take the child, and hold him by the hand because I will make a great nation of him.”

19.verse: God opened her eyes, and she was able to see a spring of water. She went over to it and filled the skin and gave the child some water to drink.

20.verse: God was with the child, and he grew and lived in the desert and became an archer.

21.verse: He lived in the desert of Paran, and his mother found him a wife in the land of Egypt.

22.verse: First Link with the Promised Land. -At that time, Abimelech along with Phicol, the commander of his army, came and said to Abraham, “God is with you in everything that you do.

23.verse: Therefore, swear by God that you will not act deceitfully with me or with my sons or my descendants. As I have been friendly to you, so too, you will be friendly with me and with the land in which you have dwelt as a guest.”

24.verse: Abraham answered, “I swear it.”

25.verse: But Abraham complained to Abimelech about a well that the servants of Abimelech had seized.

26.verse: Abimelech said, “I do not know who did this thing. You never told me about this and I did not hear about it until today.”

27.verse: So Abraham took some sheep and cattle and gave them to Abimelech, and the two of them made a covenant.

28.verse: Abraham set apart seven fat lambs.

29.verse: Abimelech said to Abraham, “What is the meaning of the seven lambs that you have set aside?”

30.verse: He answered, “Please take these seven lambs from me, and let them be a sign to you that I dug this well.”

31.verse: Because of this the place is called Beer-sheba (the well of the seven), for they both swore an oath there.

32.verse: After the covenant had been concluded at Beer-sheba, Abimelech and Phicol, the commander of his army, left and returned to the land of the Philistines.

33.verse: Abraham planted a tamarisk at Beer-sheba, and there he called upon the name of the Lord, the Eternal God.

34.verse: Abraham dwelt in the land of the Philistines for many years.

1.verse: Chapter 22 -Sacrifice of the Son. -Some time later God tested Abraham. He said to him, “Abraham, Abraham!” He replied, “Here I am!”

2.verse: God said, “Take your son, your only son, the one you love, Isaac, and go to the land of Moriah and offer him as a burnt offering on the mountain that I will show you.”

3.verse: Abraham rose early in the morning, saddled a donkey, and took two servants and his son Isaac with him. He also took the wood for the burnt offering and set out toward the place about which God had spoken.

4.verse: On the third day, Abraham looked up and saw that place from a distance.

5.verse: Abraham said to his servants, “Stay here with the donkey. I and the boy will go over there. We will worship and then we will return to you.”

6.verse: Abraham took the wood for the burnt offering and loaded it upon his son Isaac. He himself carried the fire and the knife. They then set out together.

7.verse: Isaac turned to his father Abraham and said, “My father!”He answered, “Here I am, my son.”He continued, “Here are the fire and the wood, but where is the lamb for the burnt offering?”

8.verse: Abraham answered, “God himself will provide the lamb for the burnt offering, my son!” And the two of them went on together.

9.verse: They then arrived at the place of which God had spoken. There Abraham built an altar and piled up the wood. He tied up his son Isaac and placed him upon the altar so that he was lying upon the wood.

10.verse: Then Abraham reached out and took the knife to kill his son.

11.verse: But the angel of the Lord called out from heaven and said, “Abraham! Abraham!”He answered, “Here I am.”

12.verse: The angel said, “Do not reach out your hand against the boy! Do not harm him in any way! Now I know that you fear God and you have not even withheld your son, your only son, from me.”

13.verse: Abraham looked up and saw a ram that had its horns caught in a bush. Abraham took the ram and offered it as a burnt offering instead of his son.

14.verse: Abraham called that place, “The Lord will provide,” for he said, “On the mountain the Lord provided.”

15.verse: The angel of the Lord called Abraham from heaven again

16.verse: and said, “I swear by my own self, thus says the Lord: because you have done this and did not withhold your son from me, your only son,

17.verse: I will bless you with every blessing and I will make your descendants very numerous, like the stars of the heavens or the sand on the shore of the sea. Your descendants shall take possession of the cities of your enemies.

18.verse: All the nations of the earth shall be blessed through your descendants, because you have obeyed my command.”

19.verse: Abraham returned to his servants, and together they set out toward Beer-sheba, where Abraham made his dwelling.

20.verse: Children of Abraham’s Brother. -Afterward, Abraham received this news: “Behold, Milcah has borne sons to your brother Nahor:

21.verse: Uz the firstborn, Buz his brother, Kemuel (the father of Aram),

22.verse: Chesed, Hazo, Pildash, Jidlaph, and Bethuel.”

23.verse: Bethuel became the father of Rebekah. Milcah gave birth to these eight sons for Nahor, the brother of Abraham.

24.verse: His concubine, Reumah, also bore Tebah, Gaham, Tahash, and Maacah.

1.verse: Chapter 23 -Tomb of the Patriarch. -Sarah lived to be one hundred and twenty-seven years old.

2.verse: She died at Kiriath-arba, that is Hebron, in the land of Canaan. Abraham went in to mourn for Sarah and he wept for her.

3.verse: Abraham then left the body of his loved one and said to the Hittites,

4.verse: “I am a foreigner and I sojourn among you. Sell me a piece of land here for a grave. In that way I can carry the body there and bury it.”

5.verse: The Hittites answered,

6.verse: “Hear us, my lord. You are a prince of God living in our midst. Bury your dead one in the best of our tombs. No one among us will prevent you from burying your dead in your tomb.”

7.verse: Then Abraham got up and bowed down before the people of the land, the Hittites,

8.verse: and said to them, “If it is your will that I take my deceased and bury her, listen to me and convince Ephron, the son of Zohar,

9.verse: to give me the cave of Machpelah, which is found at the edge of his field. Let him sell it to me at its full price so that it may be my burial place in your land.”

10.verse: Now Ephron was seated among the Hittites. Ephron the Hittite answered Abraham in the hearing of the Hittites at the entrance to the gate of the city. He said,

11.verse: “Hear me, my lord. I will give you the field along with the cave. In the presence of the sons of my people, I give it to you. Bury your dead.”

12.verse: Abraham bowed down to him before the people of the land.

13.verse: He spoke to Ephron in the hearing of the people of the land and said, “If only you would please listen to me, I will pay you for the price of the field. Accept it from me, so that I may bury my dead there.”

14.verse: Ephron said to Abraham,

15.verse: “Hear me, my lord. A field with a value of four hundred silver shekels, what is that between me and you? Bury your dead there.”

16.verse: Abraham accepted Ephron’s terms. He paid Ephron the price that had been mentioned in the hearing of the Hittites, namely, four hundred silver shekels of the current market weight.

17.verse: The field of Ephron was at Machpelah facing Mamre. The field and the cave found there and all the trees in the field and within the boundaries of the field,

18.verse: all these became the property of Abraham in the presence of the Hittites at the entrance to the gate of the city.

19.verse: Afterward, Abraham buried Sarah, his wife, in the cave of the field of Machpelah facing Mamre (that is Hebron), in the land of Canaan.

20.verse: The field and the cave passed from the Hittites to Abraham as his burial plot.

1.verse: Chapter 24 -The Marriage of Isaac. -Abraham was now old, well advanced in years, and the Lord had blessed him in everything.

2.verse: Abraham said to his servant, the oldest of his household, who supervised his property, “Place your hand under my thigh

3.verse: and swear to the Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, that you will not get a wife for my son from the daughters of the Canaanites among whom we live.

4.verse: Rather, go to my homeland, to my family, and choose a wife for my son Isaac.”

5.verse: The servant asked him, “If the woman does not wish to follow me to this land, should I take your son back to the land from which you came?”

6.verse: Abraham answered him, “Never take my son back there!

7.verse: The Lord, the God of heaven and the God of the earth, who called me out from the house of my father and the land of my birth, spoke to me and promised, ‘To your descendants I will give this land.’ He himself will send an angel before you so that you can find a wife for my son.

8.verse: If the woman does not wish to follow you, you will be absolved of the oath you have made to me. Only, you must not take my son back there.”

9.verse: The servant placed his hand under the thigh of Abraham, his master, and he swore an oath to him concerning these things.

10.verse: The servant took ten of his master’s camels along with all kinds of different precious objects and he set out and went to Aram-naharaim, to the city of Nahor.

11.verse: He rested the camels outside of the city, near the well, at evening time when the women would go out to draw water.

12.verse: He said, “O Lord, God of my master Abraham, grant me success today and be gracious to my master Abraham!

13.verse: Behold, I am in front of the well and the young women of the town are coming out to draw water.

14.verse: That young woman to whom I say, ‘Lower your jug and let me drink,’ and she responds, ‘Drink, and I will give your camels some water too,’ let her be the one you have chosen for Isaac, your servant. By this I will know that you have acted kindly to my master.”

15.verse: He barely finished speaking when Rebekah, who was the daughter of Bethuel, the son of Milcah, who was the wife of Abraham’s brother Nahor, came out with a jug on her shoulder.

16.verse: The young woman was very pretty and a virgin, never having slept with a man. She went down to the well and filled her jug and came back up.

17.verse: The servant hurried up to her and said, “Please give me some of the water from your jug.”
